DESCRIPTION: please see bikelane_df
unique identifier for the dataset
date time stamp of the last edit date
Paved or unpaved

Status of the specified bikeway segment. 
A: Active - existing bikeways included in our bike network
L: Legacy – Bikeways formerly included in our network, but that does not meet the minimum standard of a bike facility.

Type of bikeway facility in the East- or Southbound direction, one of:
Protected Bike Lanes: People cycling are protected from motor vehicles by physical barriers such as planters, curbs, or bollards; also includes off-street paths.
Local Street: People cycling share the roadway with motor vehicles on a relatively quiet neighbourhood street
Painted Lanes: People cycling have a dedicated painted lane, typically between the curb or parking lane and a driving lane
Shared Lanes: People cycling share a lane with vehicles on a busy street; these lanes fill network gaps but are not comfortable for most.
The overall direction of the bikeway (individual segments may not run the same direction). EW means East-West; NS means North-South
please see bikelane_df

Type of bikeway facility in the West- or Northbound direction, one of:
Protected Bike Lanes: People cycling are protected from motor vehicles by physical barriers such as planters, curbs, or bollards; also includes off-street paths.
Local Street: People cycling share the roadway with motor vehicles on a relatively quiet neighbourhood street
Painted Lanes: People cycling have a dedicated painted lane, typically between the curb or parking lane and a driving lane
Shared Lanes: People cycling share a lane with vehicles on a busy street; these lanes fill network gaps but are not comfortable for most

Direction of vehicle travel on the route:
2W: Two Way – Vehicles may travel in two directions.
OW: One Way – Vehicles may travel in one direction.
Off-street: Vehicles are not permitted on route.
Unique identifier for each bikeway segment
please see bikelane_df

Street segment types. 
Arterial: Highest capacity roads identified to be significant for access to regional activity centres and critical for the movement of goods and people through the City. Arterial routes support heavy volumes of truck, transit and vehicle traffic
Collector: Roads intended to connect neighbourhoods with the arterial road network.
Lane: Neighbourhood roads intended as the primary access point to residential and commercial properties for local services such as waste collection and parking access.
Off-Street: Routes not located on the street, includes protected bike lanes and off-street paths. Not generally intended for vehicle traffic.
Residential: Neighbourhood roads intended for the movement of people and services within local neighbourhoods.
Sec Arterial: High capacity roads critical for the movement of goods and people through the City. Routes support moderate truck, transit and vehicle traffic.
please see bikelane_df
The gejson geometry definition for the bikelane segment
Speed limit for vehicles in kilometers per hour. Zero or null for off-street routes.
please see bikelane_df
Year of construction. The year when the segment became an active bikeway of any type. Note: This field may be zero or blank if the information is not available
Whether the bikeway is on part of a snow removal route.
Year when segment was upgraded, if applicable.
Approximate length of centerline of segment measured in meters.
Name of the street where the bikeway segment is located
please see bikelane_df
please see bikelane_df

Subtype of Protected Bike Lanes.
OSB: Off Street Bike Path - Off street paths physically separated from pedestrian paths, or where cyclists are separated from pedestrians with a painted line.
OSS: Off Street (Shared with pedestrians) - Off street paths shared by cyclists and pedestrians.
SL: Street Level On Street -Protected bike lanes located on the street.
R: Raised On Street - Protect Bike Lanes located on the street, but raised to sidewalk level.
General notes not included in the other attributes.
TOP: Removed in 2020 (does not meet minimum standard of bike facility)

DESCRIPTION: Spatial representation of specified bikeway segment
The geometric representation of the bikelane within geopandas
